pullRequest.body:
`AEStronglyMeasurable` is a convenient special case of `AEStronglyMeasurable'`, but we can tweak the argument implicitness so that `AEStronglyMeasurable f Î¼` means the same thing as before while `AEStronglyMeasurable[m] f Î¼` means the same thing as the current `AEStronglyMeasurable' m f Î¼`.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c18841daf8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20932/commits/c18841daf822cdd94aac0d05ac7da715adfcec5b)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.ConditionalExpectation.AEMeasurable | 1922 | 1919 | -3 (-0.16%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Function.ConditionalExpectation.AEMeasurable`|-3|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AEStronglyMeasurable.of_subsingleton_cod`
`+ AEStronglyMeasurable.of_subsingleton_dom`
`+ aeStronglyMeasurable_condExpIndSMul`
`+ aeStronglyMeasurable_condExpL2`
`+ aeStronglyMeasurable_condexpL2`
`+ aestronglyMeasurable_condExpInd`
`+ aestronglyMeasurable_integral_condDistrib`
`+ const_inner`
`+ inner_const`
`+ lpMeas.aeStronglyMeasurable`
`+ mem_lpMeasSubgroup_iff_aeStronglyMeasurable`
`+ mem_lpMeas_iff_aeStronglyMeasurable`
`+ of_measurableSpace_le_on`
`+ of_trim`
`+-+ mono`
`+--+ stronglyMeasurable_mk`
`- aeStronglyMeasurable'_condExpIndSMul`
`- aeStronglyMeasurable'_condexpL2`
`- aestronglyMeasurable'_condExpInd`
`- aestronglyMeasurable'_integral_condDistrib`
`- lpMeas.aeStronglyMeasurable'`
`- mem_lpMeasSubgroup_iff_aeStronglyMeasurable'`
`- mem_lpMeas_iff_aeStronglyMeasurable'`
`-+-+ ae_eq_mk`
`-+-+ mk`
`--++ congr`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (0.96, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|101|1|disabled deprecation lints|
|4877|-1|exceptions for the docPrime linter|

Current commit [c18841daf8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c18841daf822cdd94aac0d05ac7da715adfcec5b)
Reference commit [b632e4bf07](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b632e4bf07f6be125b1fc831b70c479d15860c71)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

If we can make it work, it sounds like a good idea.

However consider the following example: I have 3 measurable space structures m1 <= m2 <= m3 (and m3 is the one found by typeclass inference) and a measure Âµ on m2.
Before, `AEMeasurable f Âµ` would mean `AEMeasurable[m2] f Âµ`. It looks like with your change it now means `AEMeasurable[m3] f Âµ`, which seems undesirable. Of course we could add `[m2]` in all those (perhaps rare?) cases, but the default behaviour is not great.
A similar situation is currently making CI fail. Let me try fixing it to see how often this actually happens.
Looks pretty good to me. What do you think?

It looks good! There were not many modifications needed, and apart from one case, the additional `[m]` are in places where the measure is already explicitly modified to mention that m, like `Âµ.trim hm`, so its fine.

I would like someone else to see and give a final opinion though:
maintainer merge

My previous maintainer merge failed with that error:
`FetchError: invalid json response body at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/api/v1/messages reason: Unexpected token '<', "<!doctype "... is not valid JSON`
Trying it again:
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by RemyDegenne.

Is it possible to restore the `volume_tac` default argument? (and remove the `volume` measure you added in a few places)
```suggestion
def AEStronglyMeasurable [m : MeasurableSpace Î±] {mâ‚€ : MeasurableSpace Î±} (f : Î± â†’ Î²)
    (Î¼ : Measure[mâ‚€] Î± := by volume_tac) : Prop :=
```
Oh yes of course. Not sure how I removed it

pullRequest.title: refactor: merge `AEStronglyMeasurable` and `AEStronglyMeasurable'`
